summary: Van creatieve vraagstukken ga ik AAN. Als imagineer verzamel ik de wensen en dromen van mensen. Ik ga op zoek naar 'common ground' en verken de mogelijkheden. Zo kan er worden gewerkt aan iets nieuws, iets waar iedereen energie van krijgt.

education.field_of_study: Business administration / Bedrijfskunde / Business management / Bedrijfsmanagement

education.degree_name: English A - Language and Literature (Standard Level)

projects.title: Herbestemming Visserskerk Oss
projects.description: During a time in which a lot of churches in the Netherlands are forced to shut their doors, the Holy Willibrordus parish in Oss is developing a plan for the future of the building: a temporary shelter for young mothers and newborns. For creative ideas and inspiration, they collaborate with students of the Talentencampus Oss and the Technical University of Eindhoven. As a graduation project, my goal is to develop a business model and case for the shelter that makes this future plan financially feasible and partially self-sufficient. During this project, I have assisted a core team of four healthcare professionals in their research, vision and concept development process. Finding a repurpose for a church building is a complicated challenge, due to the many stakeholders and strong-held values, as well as the relatively high maintenance and energy costs. During my project, I have done research on the context of church repurposing, I have made connections with various local (potential) partners and lead and organized multiple co-creative sessions, including a vision development session and a creative (brainstorm) session. The result is a tested repurpose concept that not only holds value for the primary target group (mothers and newborns), but also for home seekers (starters & elderly) and the local community of Oss. In this concept, the three groups are connected and social and financial valued are continually exchanged. With this concept, I succeeded in my goal to develop a financially feasible business plan in which the shelter is 40% self-sufficient.

projects.title: Floriade Almere 2022
projects.description: During my minor 'Imagineering' at Breda University of Applied Sciences, I have worked in a team of students to develop a customer experience plan for two pavilions at Floriade Almere, which will take place in 2022.

projects.title: Goudse Schouwburg
projects.description:
During my minor 'Imagineering' at Breda University of Applied Sciences, I have worked in a team of students to develop a concept in which the Goudse Schouwburg can connect with the younger generation and, in this way, stay relevant. 
Through the imagineering process, our team set up a small (online) community of young, creative people from Gouda, all looking for fun activities to do in Gouda. In this way, we planted a seed for a new enterprising generation that could collaborate with the Goudse Schouwburg to organize cultural events and activities.

projects.title: BlueOpes
projects.description: This project took place during a study trip to Budapest, Hungary. Our mission was to introduce an Hungarian online stock advisor program, called BlueOpes, to the Dutch market. Our team's research results indicated that the most important challenge to attracting Dutch investors was 'gaining trust', so we developed a concept for a non-binding online test environment for stock-marketing. The goal of this concept was to let the investors 'try before they buy'.

contributors.headline: Senior Associate - Responsible for Controlling & Finance Management at James Woodman | Finance Recruitment

projects.title: Innovation In A Week Uden 2016: VIES
projects.description:
Seven days long, from 9 AM to 10 PM, we worked in a team to write and present an entire business plan. The mission of my team was to design an innovative product withing the theme of Healthy Business 3.0, in partnership with Gemeente Uden. During the week, we were coached by several experienced entrepreneurs who thaught us a lot about business modelling. 

My team and I designed a new modular type of outdoor playset and named it VIES. With this, we came up with a radically innovative rotating system concept, in which children could vote online for which next playset would be installed in their neighbourhood. Through the collection of this data, a competitive concept arose for the playsets: 'Survival of the Funnest'. It refers to the system, in which the preferences of the children almost directly decide which Playsets will stay and which would leave the market.

Awards :
1st place: Best Team Award
2nd place: Best Innovation Award

profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description: OnzeAuto maakt het mogelijk voor bewoners uit dezelfde buurt om gezamenlijk elektrische auto's te delen. Zo dragen ze bij aan een versnelde elektrificatie van het wagenpark en betere leefbaarheid in de wijk, aangezien er meer ruimte vrijkomt voor bijvoorbeeld groen. Als kwartiermaker heb ik een coördinerende rol in het realiseren en doorontwikkelen van autodeelinitiatieven in Nederland. Dit gebeurt in samenwerking met bewoners, ambassadeurs en andere stakeholders.  Bij OnzeAuto doe ik dan ook veel ervaring op met de complexe dynamiek van 'eigenaarschap' in co-creatieve projecten. Ik ben een contactpersoon voor lokale deelgemeenschappen en denk samen met de ambassadeurs mee over lokale acties en campagnes. Intrinsiek word ik daarnaast gedreven tot de doorontwikkeling van diverse bedrijfsprocessen binnen OnzeAuto. Ik organiseer met alle plezier de creatieve sessies met het team. In alle gevallen denk en werk ik vanuit de kern van het concept 'autodelen in communities', d.w.z. lokaal. gezamenljk. eigenaarschap.

profile_positions.title: Co-Founder

profile_positions.description: Internship assigment: to develop a concept that would help elderly people to be able to live longer independently at home. I didnt want to focus on a product that people would become reliant on. Instead, I chose for a preventive solution that empowers people. My research lead me to the root problem of becoming vulnerable at an older age: the unhealthy ways in which a lot of people live, leading to all kinds of physical, mental and social problems and illnesses. The final concept therefor was directed at a younger generation: by offering easy accessible exercise courses at work, the working generation would be supported in becoming and remaining healthier and independent as they get older.
